review.title: Nice Staff. Comfy bed, Spacious Room
review.reviewText: The time we went to San Fran all the hotels were almost sold out since there was a convention so this was our last option. It was definitely overpriced about 2 times what it normally is. However, the staff was super accommodating since we arrived about 5am and couldn't check in till around 3p, they let us store our bags so we could go out and explore the city. It was really convenient that the hotel included a breakfast buffet since there are no other restaurants around. I thought the buffet had a lot of variety. As for the hotel room it was spacious with two king beds and the beds were really comfy. The air con though was a bit confusing to use since it tends to go to heater when you put it to 70 degrees and has to be 69 or less to be cold. I did like this hotel but I wouldn't choose it again since it isn't close to the city and there isn't much around the area for food options.

review.title: Reasonable price and close to SF airport
review.reviewText:
The hotel is close to the airport but also next to the freeways although our room was quiet.
  We first looked at a room toward the back of the hotel but that area looked bad and could have real
  security issues for the room and also for your car.
   We asked for and got another room which was up toward the lobby and was fine.  The beds were
   great and the pillow selection wonderful.
   The breakfast buffet was good with a wide selection of scrambled eggs, sausages, juices, yogurt,
    waffles, fruit, etc.  
   Our main complaint was the unexpected parking fee of about $6 which did not seem fair as there
   was not a secured entrance or any security guard.  
   The wifi worked fine after help from the front desk.

    The motel is close to the downtown area and we had a wonderful dinner at a Thai restaurant that
    seemed to be the popular place in town.

review.title: NON SMOKING!!??!!
review.reviewText:
The title says it all.... we came into our room through an outdoor party that involved smoking of pot and cigs, beer and loud yelling at 9pm which involved about 6 or 7 people and whom ever was in the room (the door was open).   This was a scary crowd and we quickly got into our room.  We hoped it would improve but didn't until we called down to the front desk and told them what was going on... after 2 more calls and a response that they didn't see anything wrong and it was all OK they finally came up and told the "guests" to quiet down (it was now 10:15) and after yelling and swearing mainly in Spanish and threatening calling the Cops the party got off of the corridor and into the room but we got the fun of the Pot Smoke seeping into our room.  They got noisy again and finally after calling again and being told that WE could be moved to another room, came up and Moved the other "Guests" so finally quiet came at about 10:45. ish but no one came to tell us what was going on or to phone us.  This horrible guest service was reinforced the next day when we inquired about having the room given as comp. for the distress and lack of pleasant environment as advertised.  The answer was we'll give you your parking free.... Further inquiry to the manager said that we'd have to deal with Expedia as they didn't know how much we had paid for the room.  The more we inquired the more we were made to feel that it was OUR fault that this happened!!!  
;

review.title: Loudest heater fan ever.
review.reviewText: I must have gotten the leftover room.  Handicap accessible, even though I didn't request it.  That part is ok.  But in the extra spacious bathroom, there was no counter space to put or lay out my toiletries.  The bathroom exhaust fan grid hung several inches from the ceiling.  The hair dryer hung precariously from the wall by one out of four anchors.   The room door dead bolted, but did not have the normal safety latch that allows one to partially open the door to see who's out there.  Just outside the hotel property is the Caltrain station, so train horns, bells and rumbling can be heard most hours of the day.  And when I turned on the heater in the room, it sounded like a toy diesel truck.  I stay in hotels on average twice a week all year long, and this ranked as one of the top three loudest I have ever heard.  In a sold-out hotel at my 11:30pm check-in time, I didn't have the energy to call the front desk and ask for a different room.  I just turned off the heater and slept in the cold.
review.positiveRemarks: Microwave and refrigerator in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Repair the heater, exhaust fan grid, hairdryer mount, and add a safety latch to the door.

review.title: Room okay, but bad hotel condition & location
review.reviewText:
This hotel has external doors like a motel, the parking lot is dimly lit and the elevators, stairs and walkways are open and accessible to strangers.  So, I felt very unsafe.  It's next to a train track and highway, and I woke with the bed shaking in the middle of the night as a train went by. The exterior of the hotel is extremely run down, dirty and in desperate need of repair, paint and renovation.

Positives: Close to airport, room was very clean, and the man at the front desk was courteous.  But you have to pay for parking, and the area is very remote and backs up to a train track.  Since the hotel was so run-down, I didn't feel comfortable eating their free breakfast or using the pool and hot tub.

Perhaps suitable for a man traveling alone, I would not recommend this hotel for families or female travelers.

review.reviewText:
The hotel was clean which was nice and the breakfast wasn't bad. What I didn't care for was that the back portion of the hotel is right under the freeway. We arrived at night and I definitely would not be comfortable walking around outside at night. If I had to use one word to describe the area I would choose "sketchy". Also, the hotel is right next to train tracks with a crossing so you can expect to be woken up by that crossing ding followed by a train horn every half hour or so. 
I was there on business and we worked through the night until the early am. Due to the train, we were not able to get any sleep before returning to work.

review.title: Hotel close to airport
review.reviewText:
The hotel was about as expected for a basic, no frills hotel. I was able to get an early check in. Later during my stay I dropped off a rental car and followed the instructions from the front desk to get the shuttle back to the hotel. The shuttle is supposed to run every half hour but I and about five other people waited about 50 minutes for the shuttle to arrive only to find it full and the driver would not let us board. He told us he would be back but refused to give a time estimate. This was at 11:30 PM so I ended up spending $20 on a cab ride to the hotel. I asked for reimbursement at the front desk but was refused. The next morning the shuttle worked as planned.
Breakfast was typical but at least there was a nice area to sit, unlike so many Comfort Inns.
The air conditioner would not cool the room. The alarm clock went off at midnight but thanks to the shuttle disaster, I was still awake.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport.

review.title: Will look for a different hotel next time...
review.reviewText: We've stayed here twice now as its close to our sons school and apartment but will look for a different hotel next time.  Both times we have stayed, the Internet has not worked - the first time we were told it was because we were too "far" from the lobby but this time we had a room just up from the lobby.  We had to wait when we checked in as there was no one at the front desk, and even then the guy checking us in was brusque at best. The room was okay - although it was HOT when we checked in and we had issues trying to regulate the temp all night. The breakfast area in the morning was not kept up - no one was busing tables, or cleaning anything up on the buffet.

But shuttle driver must be given a tip(I do not understand this culture) if you have luggage otherwise he will give you a bad look.
In room facilities contains microwave, coffee maker, abundant charging sockets including USB charging ports. Pricing is decent as per SFO standard but overall SFO is in itself costly. But this hotel's policy of allowing 4 guests in a room makes it economical for one night bigger groups.

review.title: Convenient hotel close to airport
review.reviewText:
I wanted a hotel close to SFO airport, with shuttle service, for overnight stay while traveling. This hotel provided what I needed. It is an older property but well maintained and comfortable and reasonably quiet although near freeways and railroad and (of course) the airport. My room faced outward, but other than some train whistles and RR crossing bells in the evening and morning was pretty quiet. If quiet means a lot to you, I'd suggest asking for a room facing one of the two courtyards. The room was spacious (king-size bed, full-size couch, desk, dresser, etc.) and so was the bathroom. The furnishings in the bedroom were older, but the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom fixtures looked new. All was clean, with no smell. The individual heating/AC system worked fine, as did the TV. The lighting in the bedroom was not great (not very bright, lamps elderly), but that in the bathroom was fine.

The shuttle service was excellent; check-in was fine, although a couple ahead of me seemed to be having some difficulties. The desk staff were efficient (for me) but not especially welcoming. The breakfast area next to the lobby was quite large and very clean, and the free continental breakfast actually included eggs and sausage as well as toast, waffles, cereal, fruit, yogurt, juice, and decent coffee.

I think this was a good basic airport hotel, and was good value--especially in pricy San Francisco.

The hotel provides a map of the property so you can find your room easily.
review.positiveRemarks: I found the hotel provided all I needed for an overnight stay and it really is a short drive from SFO airport.
review.negativeRemarks: I'd love a bit more lighting--and the light switch is not next to the front door but on the side wall, so it's a bit tricky to find.

review.title: Flea Infestation!!!
review.reviewText: Close to airport and SF. Loud street traffic noise. Lack of parking. Decent breakfast. But most horribly ... flea bites. We got two rooms and both rooms had fleas.

review.title: Decent stay
review.reviewText: Decent hotel just outside the main city and about a 25 minute drive into downtown (union square) if traffic is good

After a long day at the Wharf, we drove to the hotel arriving about 11:30 pm.  We were given a room and as we put the key card it turned green allowing us to open the door...except there was a chain that was latched from the inside and of course ....someone was in the room and in bed.  We told the front desk and they put us in another room on the other side of the hotel.
As we drove to look for parking close to that side...there were a couple of cars that parked over the line, making it unable to park safely.  We drove again to the other side and walked over our luggage to the room.     3:30 am ....EARTHQUAKE!!
In the morning we were able to have a nice breakfast.

You asked about our experience and that is what I have put.  : )
review.positiveRemarks:
The rooms were very nice and comfortable and CLEAN!  

Although we didn't use it ...it had a fridge and I believe a microwave.

review.title: Hard to get to from the freeway
review.reviewText: Not easy to get to from the freeway.  Room was small and the carpet felt damp and not clean.  Hotel staff was friendly.  Lots of choices available for breakfast (not enough seating)  Did not know parking was not included.  Had to pay additional $6 per night for parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast and Hotel Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Hard to get to from the freeway.  Nearby restaurants are across a large bridge with lots of traffic.  I wouldn't walk there after dark.

review.title: Never coming back here
review.reviewText: Room dirty, no smoking but smell like smoking . We had to ask for another room because of the smell. We found 2 fleas in our room. So bad.  Never coming back here.

The electric plugs in the room had about 6 plugs in it already.  Kept falling out so the lamps around the bed would go off.  Noisey.   Ended up with bug bites in morning.  Breakfast was so-so.  Will not go back.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing

Reception staff unfriendly and not helpful.They don't make you feel welcomed- not a smile or greeting. Not willing to confirm your flight.
review.positiveRemarks: close to airport and the shuttle

San Francisco has a very good public transport system so I would opt for a hotel far from the airport specially for longer stays.' Noise-free rooms are not guaranteed' indeed, not even the courtyard view rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: The shuttle service is very efficient and always on time.
review.negativeRemarks: The room carpet.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to the airport with many dining options in the vicinity. For things to do, we had to go to downtown San Francisco.

review.reviewText: The Hotel Staff was Great, they helped us with directions, storage of our bags and were very nice. Hotel was clean and breakfast was fresh.

review.title: Motel nice but noisy

review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant

review.reviewText:

No place to sit to eat breakfast
review.locationRemarks: You could walk to the Cal Train from here

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel because it is close to the airport with free shuttle. It fit our needs very well. The staff at the reception desk was not very friendly but did check us in quickly. Breakfast was very good and included in cost. There is a train that runs behind the motel so ask for a room not on that side. It is quite loud at 5 am.

review.title: Not Easy to Find
review.reviewText: Very difficult to find. East Grand road is weirdly situated off of an overpass and coming from the North you can't see the building nor the Comfort sign.  The $6 parking fee was a surprise too.   It's next to a train station and in the departure path for SFO airport.  I'm just saying.....
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a bar and restaurant, but Embassy Suites is a short walk and they have both.

review.title: Great Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was perfect for what we needed-a close, clean place to stay overnight for a flight the next day. We didn't need much from the staff but they were friendly when we checked in and they even ran breakfast late because there were a lot of people still there getting food. It was noisy being so close to the airport but the bed was so comfortable it was easy to fall asleep.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable beds, clean, reasonable rate.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much parking and you had to pay. Also, there was a stale smell in elevators and room but not too bad.

review.title: Nice hotel next to train yard
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel to get a good night sleep before we flew out of San Francisco International in the morning rather then making a car trip in the morning from the North Bay. As we arrived we could already see that there was a train yard about 100ft across the street.  We expected some noise from the train tracks but we did not anticipate this noise to be going on all night all the way into the early morning. Loud engine noise, metal on metal  sounds you name it. I thought I was in the middle of the train yard. We stayed in Room 201  which was perhaps one of the closed rooms to the train yard. Also be aware this hotel is right next o a major highway and planes are taking of right above it. These 2 things I was anticipating.
review.positiveRemarks: It was in good shape
review.negativeRemarks: I am already paying a steep price to stay at your hotel. Why nickel and dime me with a parking fee.

review.positiveRemarks: Nice hotel for the price. Room was nice with lots of room.

It was fine It was still fine this review is irritating

Found an excellent Mex restaurant, La Nueva Perla. Great food, mass quantities - super find, a couple of blocks off Grand. All in all, the hotel was a great value.

review.title: Shuttle Left Without Us
review.reviewText: We specifically explained that we needed to be on the airport shuttle at 5:35am (as scheduled) and we had our luggage waiting in the lobby by 5:20am. We had to go back to the room to grab something but returned at 5:36am only to watch the shuttle drive off...at that time of day, it's not exactly easy to get a cab either. This was totally ridiculous when the front desk knew specifically our situation and we had our 16mo. old baby with us... Created unnecessary stress on our return trip - it's not like they had soo many other patrons to drive at that time (the shuttle was completely empty!!).

review.title: Clean and close to airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfect for an overnight stay. We had tickets to Giants Exhibition game, CALTRAIN was at walking distance. They had a nice breakfast, and the hotel was very clean. Also a good alternative for people who don't want the hustle and bustle of downtown San Francisco. Beds were VERY comfortable and the bathroom was clean:)

review.title: Expedia gave us the wrong info
review.reviewText: I have stayed at many Comfort Inns and have never had a bad experience....actually they have all been favorable. When the reservation was made the Expedia Representative repeated 3 times that parking was included in the rate. I made him repeat this and every time it was the same. The hotel states that there is a $6.00 parking fee not included in the Expedia rate and it states so on their agreement. Th hotel Mgr. was very nice and said he would let it go this one time when I explained what happened. As for the hotel...so so...breakfast not as fresh and tasty as other breakfasts at Comfort Inn. the worse part of our stay was the train directly across the street that ran by our room every 15 minutes. If we knew of the train we would have chosen somewhere else. the noise from the room above sounded like they were moving furnitutre at10 pm and you could actually hear voices from the room next door. Sorry Comfort Inn....
review.positiveRemarks: close to airport
review.locationRemarks: location by the railroad if you like trains and whistles....restaurants in area so so

However to get to the hotel room you had to walk very far outside. It was cold out our day so this part was not very nice. It was way to cold to have to walk as far as we did outside. It would be pretty during the warm summer though.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice rooms and service.
review.negativeRemarks: Closer elevators, explanation of the hotel being primarily outside on the Expedia website.
review.locationRemarks: Airport was near by and downtown was around ten miles away.

review.title: Exactly what we expected.
review.reviewText: The room and amenities were exactly what we expected for the price we paid. Could hear tge train at night but our Window didn't face the tracks so it wasn't an issue. At checkout charged us a daily parking fee that was unknown to us at checkin. Would have appreciated knowing at checkin. Overall average hotel nice continental breakfast and convenient airport shuttle.

review.title: Nice hotel near CalTrain
review.reviewText: Nice hotel across street from CalTrain--easy to walk to train in 5 minutes. Train costs $3 and gets you to downtown SF in 16 minutes. Clean, fast, comfortable train. Hotel has free airport shuttle, decent standard hot hotel breakfast, well tended and replenished. Rooms large and comfy (we got the king suite with sitting area), has small fridge and micro. Bath clean and large. Two of us stayed 6 days and did not feel cramped. Rates are very cheap compared to downtown SF and you can be in the city very quickly. Bed was comfy and many pillows of different types makes picking a good one easy. Hotel has exterior corridors and is a two story sort-of mock Adobe style. A great three star hotel. We'd stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location close to CalTrain, easy walk to train. Train ride is 16 min to city. One king bed room is very large and comfy.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast attendant was so efficient in replacing foods and cleaning tables that I lost several cups of coffee when I went back to get more food.
review.locationRemarks: Cal Train to city is 5 min walk. NOTHING near the hotel. NOTHING.

review.title: SFO Stay Near Airport
review.reviewText: The hotel worked for us logically because we were in San Francisco for two nights before flying out. We did not have a car, so the hotel shuttle service was able to transport us between the airport and the hotel. From there we used the BART to get downtown to the waterfront. The staff was very accommodating and pleasant. The reviews were correct about the noise level. It was from the trans (not planes for being near the airport) that ran next to the hotel every few minutes till 11 pm. Fortunately, Edmond was very helpful at the front desk was able to relocate us to quieter room.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, comfortable and offered a good breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe some kind of sound barrier wall would help at least the lower floor rooms with the noise.

The double king rooms are a bit tight in walking space however you get two king beds that are comfortable and that is why you are there to sleep. This last trip was my 4th stay at this hotel and will always come back here for a quick overnight stay. If you need to sleep quiet as a mouse a nicer downtown hotel is probably a better fit, this is in a busy area. All in all this hotel offers what they advertise

review.title: Comfort Inn in South San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were good and friendly. But we had a room close to highway and railway. It was clean but was very very noisy. Then we switched to a room in a quieter area. But our neighbors next doors smoked at the hallway and spoke very loudly. The foot steps from up floors were very noisy too. It was a very uncomfortable stay at Comfort Inn that night.

review.title: Close to SFO Airport
review.reviewText: My daughter and I spent the night here before flying home the next morning. The location was very close to the airport and very convenient. However it is a noisy neighborhood being next door not only to the airport but also Highway 101 (freeway) and the train tracks. The room was comfortable and clean, and the breakfast buffet was a complete breakfast (including eggs, sausage,waffle). The front office staff was very friendly and welcoming. We were pleased with the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Door was not very tight - I could see light coming through thus allowing the outside noise to enter room.

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: It's one of the better budget priced hotel out there. Very cleaned, rooms are in okay size while the bathroom is great. Didn't expect a functioning gym room but I was wrong, Gym is in okay size but has treadmill and elliptical machine that actually works. Breakfast in the morning is awesome. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that's going to San Francisco for people in a budget or people that will stay in San Francisco for many days.

review.title: nice and clean
review.reviewText: there is a hitting $6 +tax parking charge. watch out.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: The location is the only reason we stay there. The pillows are nice. The sheets and bed comforter are scratchy. The hotel does not allow pets, and quite frankly allowing pets certainly will not hurt it any. The rooms are dark and dingy, the water pressure is way too low, and the courtyard is pretty much just grass with a Jacuzzi.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is convenient to San Francisco. Only 12-miles and easy on/off access to Hwy 101. The price is reasonable if you book far enough ahead.
review.negativeRemarks: They need high count cotton sheets and better quality comforters on the bed, allow pets, add privacy curtains, and add some nice landscape.

review.title: Best hotel I've stayed
review.reviewText: Clean room!! Super friendly staffs!! Comfortable bed!! Pillow too soft though

review.title: okay hotel, cleanliness was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: friendly staff, room cleanliness are excellent. The outside noise was ok, not so bad.
review.negativeRemarks: shower needs improvement water dripping badly.
review.locationRemarks: didn't do anything, the good thing is freeway access near by.

review.title: Great, convenient place to stay near the airport.
review.reviewText: The room was pretty standard! Very clean which I appreciated. Breakfast in the morning was great. One thing that I didn't like was the shuttle took 30 minutes to pick us up curbside. I wish we had a better idea of the timing.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, close to caltrain, good breakfast, great price!
review.negativeRemarks: More frequent shuttle
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the South SF caltrain stop.

review.reviewText: ok experience
review.positiveRemarks: ok
review.negativeRemarks: front desk could be more helpful

review.title: Excellente!
review.reviewText: I just got back from San Francisco and this hotel added to the memorable experience! I was a little skeptical at first from the outside appearance, but it is very warm and welcoming. The staff were always very helpful...Even when trying to manage a rude customer. They were always professional. The room was always clean and looked newly renovated. It also included airport transportation, free WiFi and a GREAT breakfast! Great for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, WiFi, breakfast and airport transportation
review.locationRemarks: Close to Caltrain

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was a very nice and well kept ,room was clean and bed was cofortable. They had a great complimenty full breakfast in the morning. Only complanint is that the shuttles take too long to pick you up at the airport. I saw 3 different hotels come by multiple times before this hotel shuttle came by. Would stay there again !

review.title: Older hotel needs to be updated.
review.reviewText:
I don't feel particularly safe when I see light around a closed, locked, bolted door.
The breakfast area is way too small for the number of guest rooms.

review.title: Nice hotel to stay
review.reviewText: Pretty convenient to drive to San Francisco and the international airport (SFO). Hotel condition is Ok.
review.positiveRemarks: it has a spa. pretty clean.
review.negativeRemarks: pretty crowded when have breakfast at about 8 a.m.
review.locationRemarks: Pretty close to the city.

review.title: Way to loud because of the trains passing by.

review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't use the rooms so near the train tracks.
review.locationRemarks: We only had one night there.

review.title: Good location near the airport.
review.reviewText:
Our room had all the things necessary to make our stay comfortable, plus a refrigerator and a microwave.
With earplugs the noise from airplanes was not an issue. The grounds were very nice. We'd stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast area could be a bit bigger for such a big complex.

review.title: Great for price
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel because of decent ratings and great price. We were very happy with our choice. We came to town to see the City. This hotel offers free shuttles to and from the airport. We were able to take the shuttle each day to the airport, which also houses a BART station. A roundtrip pass to Union square is $16.50. That's how we got to downtown each day. This is a no frills hotel, but safe, convenient, clean and economical.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very helpful, the drivers were great, the breakfast was awesome.
review.negativeRemarks: The train is right next to this hotel, which ran periodically throughout the night. If you are Avery light sleeper, this may be a problem for you.
review.locationRemarks: The location isn't that far from the airport...about a 10 min drive. But there is nothing to walk to around the hotel. No restaurants or shopping.

review.title: I won't stay at this hotel again.
review.reviewText: Poor location. No restaurant nearby. Staff failed to give me the wakeup call that I requested.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Short stay - six hr. layover from Honolulu to Memphis

review.title: Clean and Roomy
review.reviewText: The room was clean and newly renovated and had a large flat screen TV.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and roomy.
review.negativeRemarks: The refrigerator was older but worked fine.
review.locationRemarks: We were there for work, and it was close to our project.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: The rooms were fairly nice, but noisy. The doors did not seal properly which made it drafty and loud.
review.positiveRemarks: Price was right. Staff was nice. Breakfast was ok.

review.title: Spend a night waiting for my flight out of SFO.
review.reviewText: I booked through expedia, the hotel is ok. Kind of lonely neighborhood full of warehouses no near restaurants. They have a good shuttle service to the airport that starts at 4am, that was the main reason for the stay. The rooms are very clean and very well maintained, the rooms seems to be renovated with flat TV and small fridge, room is spacious and bathroom size is ok, all seems brand new. When checking out their computer system was broken, they promised to send me the receipt by email, they never did, but I booked through expedia so I really dont need it. My only complain is that my upstairs neighbors were making a lot of footstep noise, it was so hard they kept me up until midnight. Rooms are not that well noise isolated, but not of concern.
review.positiveRemarks: The room
review.negativeRemarks: No snack vending machines just sodas and water, no near restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: Very lonely location, warehouses and garage shops not to shiny.

review.title: Worked for the long weekend site-seeing visit
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to airport and not terribly hard to find. Free breakfast had enough choices to keep you occupied for a day or two. I would have enjoyed a different choice of hot items every other day or so to keep it interesting for those staying longer. Rooms were clean and seemed recently updated. The bathrooms were fairly spacious, but I would have used the extra wall space for more towel racks. (they don't really dry that well on a hook) We were right by the highway, so there was some noise, but that's a given at a hotel.

review.title: Good hotel if u don't care about comfort.
review.reviewText: Don't wanna spend too much money then get this one. Hotel is okay not for me tho. I booked this one just because my friends booked this hotel before letting me know, but there is no way I would stay here again. At least that what I hope to. Lol.

review.title: Airport hotel
review.reviewText: Much better than we had expected. Breakfast was great and shuttle service to airport available.
review.positiveRemarks: See above and grounds staff
review.negativeRemarks: Larger glasses. No control over trains!
review.locationRemarks: Only one night stop to catch early flight

review.title: Satisfactory hotel for SF price level
review.reviewText:
When the shuttle bus dropped me at this inn, I was a little bit worried where I can have my supper.
But hotel staff smiled and handed me a list of restaurants nearby.

Actually, restaurants are located within walking distance, although you have to walk for a couple of minutes over Caltrain till you reach the area where there are more or less 10 restaurants.

Caltrain station is also within 10 minutes walk.
Easy and economical access to San Francisco and Palo Alto area.
Free airport shuttle was punctual.
Room condition and continental breakfast was OK, too.

review.title: Very convenient to the aiirport
review.reviewText: Would definitely stay there again. The only issue is the lack of a nearby restaurant
review.locationRemarks: No restaurants nearby

review.title: night before a flight

review.positiveRemarks: Room and bathroom were VERY CLEAN, plus very comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: It needed to be close to the airport. and it was! perfect

review.title: Near the airport

review.locationRemarks: The drive into either San Francisco or Oakland is very easy. "Downtown" South San Francisco is close with a variety of restaurants and some small shop

review.title: Perfect for early morning flight!
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because we had a 6am flight out of SFO. We didn't check in until around 9:30pm the night before....the front seat person was super friendly & gave us all the info we needs about the shuttle. Very frequent pick ups & it was right on time. I used to stay at la Quinta, but I think if you don't need to leave your car for an extended time, I think this is the place to go for the price.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Breakfast was good alot of variety.Everything that was promised

review.title: big surprise: parking fees w/o adv info!
review.reviewText: I don't like that I was surprised by the fact that there was a parking charge of $6 per night and was no mention on the Expedia website or by the hotel untll you come to the hotel and then you are told you have to pay $6 and then a10 percent parking tax per night. In addition, parking spaces were extremely narrow and there were a number of cars are not parked straight making the parking situation extremely tight to unavailable. I will not stay in any Choice Hotel properties again.

review.title: The bed was very comfortable!
review.reviewText: The the hotel is a *little* noisy, I slept better one the one night I stayed at the Comfort Inn & Suites San Francisco Airport North than I did my entire trip! That was a definite plus. The rooms are tad run down, as is the entire hotel, but I really would recommend a stay if you want comfortable sleep and convenience to the airport for your travel the next day.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish they could update the property a little, and the TV channel choices could be better.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to a very nice restaurant and had a wonderful meal. The hotel itself is very near the airport, the train yard, and highway 101.

review.title: Close to airport,free shuttle

review.title: The room too dim.

review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast, free shuttle bus to the airport, Free Wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: The lighting of the room & toilet. There's smell of mildew in the room. Free carpark.
review.locationRemarks: Chinese Restaurants, IHOP, Denny's.

review.title: Good hotel. Kind of a distance from anything.

review.title: Front desk workers need to learn customer service
review.reviewText: We were originally given a queen size suite although we had reserved a king suite. When we went back to complain, Claudia was very rude and told us that all the beds were the same size and that the rooms only had one or two beds. She insisted we were given a king bed and was very rude. I ended up going back to the room and stripping the bed to take a picture of the tag that stated it was a queen size bed. We went back down to the front desk. I ask to see a manager but instead Bert helped us. He found us a king size suite and even allowed us to see the room before we accepted it.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and beds were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Better customer service
review.locationRemarks: Was loud at times due to being so close to the freeway and train tracks.

review.title: Nice accommodations

review.title: Nice!

They have everything what hotels are supposed to have. Even free breakfast was awesome!

review.title: 2 star hotel at 4 star price

review.positiveRemarks: Bathroom was pretty good. For a cheaper chain hotel, it was fine. It was convenient. I would not plan on staying for other than a night or two.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could be a little more sociable.
review.locationRemarks: Only an airport hotel. Didn't plan on doing anything there.

review.title: Hotel provides access to & from airport & Bart

review.title: Hard to sleep - thin walls, noisey!

review.title: Nice hotel, great for baseball games at AT&T Park

The continental breakfast looked outstanding and I loved the fact they honored our do not disturb sign the whole time we were there.
review.positiveRemarks: Having two king sized beds in the room was great!

Watch out for parking they say its free but when u get to the counter there is a charge.

There are some nice resturants close by.

I would do it again beautiful city.

review.negativeRemarks: Computer very slow. I had to do air boarding passes and took forever

They kept our rooms very clean! With no doubt we will go again! Front desk was also very nice and friendly. Overall I do recomend this hotel to anyone. It holds good memories for myfamily and I.

It was difficult trying to book a hotel with good reviews and I was skeptical about this hotel, but surprisingly it met all my standards and i appreciated the cleanliness of our room.

review.negativeRemarks: A bit noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeways and about a 20min drive to downtown. Various places to eat including ihop and there is a costco near by to fill up on gas.

review.title: Remodeled rooms are great. Older ones need help.

Management was very polite and moved us to a remodeled room in the back of the property. It was a great and quiet room. I would stay there again as long as I don't get a room in the front.
review.positiveRemarks: Management was polite. Free breakfast was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel the rest of the rooms.

review.positiveRemarks: Decent breakfast

review.title: COMFORT INN & SUITES 4-6 JUL 2013

review.title: Great locations, good value!

I want to wash some clothes but the dryer doesn't work and they arrainge to do the job for me in the hotel laundry. Very friendly.
We will stay there next year

review.title: Nice place to stay

review.positiveRemarks: The Continental Breakfast was excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms look like they have been updated, but can use some TLC.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: My family and I stayed 3 nights. Our stay would have even been better If the motel would be able to allow roll a way beds. Besides our three kids needing to share a bed, it was a great place to stay.

review.title: Would not choose this hotel again
review.reviewText:
My room was located on the outside of the hotel facing a heavy industrial area, which was very noisy. Also the noises from the room next door were quite audible all night long with door banging and some shouting. In the morning I noticed police patrolling the parking lot. I really did not feel safe here.

The table lamps had rust on the bases, the door was shabby - the decor looked tired. I checked for bedbugs and did not find anything so I stayed, but I will spring for a more expensive hotel at SFO next time.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: noise

review.title: Non Compliance
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok, but I had requested a non-smoking room, but when I went to bed at 11PM the bed and pillows reeked of secondhand smoke. It was hard to get to sleep and too late to do anything about it. I made the mistake assuming it was a non-smoking room because it was written on my reservation.

review.title: Nice hotel but too close to noise makers
review.reviewText:
While the room's physical attributes were great, the environment was difficult to deal with. The sounds of Hwy 101 and of the train were over whelming at times...made for sleep difficulties.
The staff, the room itself along with its cleanliness, the breakfast, and the price were all great...it is just too bad there has to be rooms facing Hwy 101 and the train tracks/stop.
review.positiveRemarks: The physical make up of the facility and room, and the kindles/helpfulness of the staff. Great breakfast too!
review.negativeRemarks: Next to impossible, but soundproof those rooms facing Hwy 101 and the train tracks/stop.
review.locationRemarks: Great for SFO business, and even downtown SF and nearby activities.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff. Large room and bathroom. Spotless and new condition. Excellent free breakfast, the best free breakfast I've ever seen in a hotel. Great service to and from the airport. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Staff is awesome
review.reviewText: Eric is great! Free beer is served every night underground. There are cheap tours around the city and even one to the redwoods. Overall, my experience is good. The Internet sucks from 9pm to 10:30pm

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: Good hotel. Not overly priced. Good clean rooms. Very helpful and friendly staff. Great location. Right off the highway and only a block from the South San Francisco Caltrain station. The free breakfast was actually very good with a good selection.
review.positiveRemarks: The location. Very easy to find and right near the major roadways for San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: The mattress. A little stiff for my liking.

review.title: Another Good Stay

The only issue we had was the WiFi. The wireless internet was so poor it was unusable and we had to resort to a mobile hotspot.

Otherwise it was an excellent room, two big King-size beds and a lovely breakfast.

review.negativeRemarks: The internet connection was so poor it was unusable.

review.reviewText:
Everything is good - except the internet service -- which was slow and should be upgraded.
I stay there, at least twice each baseball season, because the hotel is walking distance to the train station - and I can take the train to AT&T park.

Go Giants.
review.positiveRemarks: Location

review.title: Great Gateway stop
review.reviewText: Only stayed about seven hours while waiting for a 6am departing flight from SFO but hotel was well run and had an excellent,helpful staff. I would recommend this place to anyone. Only drawback was the freight train running about 200 feet away.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: I just stayed there for one day but it was great I have no complaints on the staff nor the hotel.

review.title: Good hotel for the family.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very well kept and peaceful. Pay for parking was inexpensive. Not close to the cities attractions so traffic can be an issue. All in all, it was a nice experience.

review.title: Okay for cheap stay
review.reviewText:
The continental breakfast / hot buffet was disappointing. The sausages were old, tough, and chewy. I couldn't get better for the toast, and no fruit.
If you're happy with cold cereal, baked goods, and high-sugar, high-carbs breakfast, you'll be fine. If you're expecting something a bit higher quality, I recommend staying somewhere else.
I went to the nearby Starbucks for breakfast on my second day.
The first night, starting at around 3 a.m., I was constantly awakened by slamming doors.
The staff was very apologetic and moved me to another, up-graded room. However, the next night it was the same thing!
The fitness facility was super tiny - looked like they turned a small guest room into a work-out room.
The area is not that great in terms of feeling safe, though access to the freeway, and some excellent far-east restaurants was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast; noisy at night

review.title: Ok for short stay

review.title: great hotel for everyone
review.reviewText: Very good except only one handicap space at the end of the bldg.
review.locationRemarks: close to the airport

review.title: Read the fine print
review.reviewText: Don't forget to read the small print. Parking is extra. For the difference in price you can stay around the corner in a nice place with free parking. I have stayed here for years, not anymore.

review.title: First time staying in San Francisco...Wonderful!!!
review.reviewText: We've stayed with other Comfort Inn and Suites and were quite satisfied. So coming to San Francisco for a few days, we needed a place to stay. Low cost and cleanliness were key. We got that plus more! Checking in was extremely quick and the front desk service were very friendly and patient w/ all of our questions. Room was very clean and modern. We did have to pay for daily parking but the free breakfast made up for that. And it wasn't a continental breakfast either - waffles, eggs (scrambled AND hard-boiled), sausage, toast, crossiants, Danish rolls, muffins, cereal, yogurt, fruits, plus orange juice, apple juice, coffee, tea, and water. Location was prime - accessible to the freeway and only 15 min to Fisherman's Wharf! Train tracks next to the hotel but could only hear it faintly mostly during the day. Kind of nostalgic to hear the train bells =). Overall, we were once again pleased w/ Comfort Inn!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly service, reasonable price, clean and modern, delicious breakfast!
review.negativeRemarks: Narrow parking spaces =(
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to freeways, easy to find, close to San Francisco and tourist spots.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Upon arrival the staff was very welcoming! After a long drive and dealing with traffic this was greatly appreciated. The cost of the room was reasonable. The location was perfect for what we needed. The only reason I gave it a 4 on the cleanliness was because there was a small burn hole on the comforter. The pillows and bed were very comfortable. The breakfast in the morning is set up well and even the staff taking care of breakfast was very pleasant! I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to the city!!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff!
review.negativeRemarks: none all fit the needs I was looking for.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location outside of the city but an easy commute in to enjoy the attractions!

review.title: Comfort Inn
review.reviewText: We were stranded in San Francisco during the winter storm in Toronto on February 8. Our first night we spent there was on the outside perimeter. It was under the highway overpass, beside the railway and near the airport. Dark & noisy. Having yet another cancelation, the front desk was kind enough to move us to the centre courtyard area, where our room was much brighter and quieter. If you book at this hotel, I would recommend the courtyard. The breakfast is not the greatest, but edible. The hotel is well-maintained and kept very clean.

review.title: "nice hotel for everyone"

review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Pay the parking
review.locationRemarks: Good location,

review.title: Great Hotel for a weekend visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Great! When I checked in all they had was something on the third floor. So they let me upgrade my room to a double king size bed for only $10.

Real close to Downtown San Fran North or South. Super close to the 49ers Stadium.
If your going to San Fran for a weekend, this is the place to stay; clean, close, and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, right off of the freeway
review.negativeRemarks: No in room Jacuzzi.

review.title: Convenient for those going to the Football Game!
review.reviewText:
WE couldn't possibly be any happier with what we received from this hotel. Breakfast is amazing. You get eggs, sausage, fruit, bread, cereal & WAFFLES! =) Definitely save some money there.

Room was clean, showers look almost new.

Parking is $7 per night. Will be added at the end of the trip.

Very convenient to Candlestick Park!

review.title: good hotel

review.title: weekend drive
review.reviewText: Great deal. Good service, spa, continental bkfst; our room had new carpet, paint, and shower
review.locationRemarks: convenient, right off the fwy

review.title: Class act all the way
review.reviewText:
After having a terrible experience at a hotel down the street, I was very pleasantly surprised at the quality and price of this hotel. Not only were the staff courteous and friendly, but the hotel was kept in a condition that one would expect from a place costing twice as much. The room was great, the breakfast was top-notch and the amenities were everything you'd expect.

At one point during my stay, the room lock failed, preventing me from getting in the room. Not only did they get someone on it right away, but they called the hotel manager back to ensure it got done quickly. While I waited the very reasonable 20 minutes or so to get in, they offered me food and drink from the kitchen and did everything possible to ensure I was happy.I do not fault them for a technology failure, and their response to it was excellent.

I highly recommend the Comfort Inn North to anyone visiting San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor, the service and the breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe that its located in San Francsico? ;)
review.locationRemarks: San Fran isnt the best place to relax, but this hotel does a good job helping you do so.

The bed was super comfortable and the room was spotless. We were catching a plane the next morning and didn't have a car and it was rainy and cool so we ordered a delicious pizza from Cecelia's which was delivered to the room.

review.title: Fix Internet connection
review.reviewText:
Good experience but did not have Internet access for entire stay over 3 days.
The front desk personnel admitted they had to replace their Router and that
is why we did not have Internet. However, while I was staying they seemed
to act like it was my PC that was the problem not the Router. I wish they would
have been more forthcoming with the root problems. I wasted a lot of time trying
to figure out how to get online access.

Other than that I thought the Hotel was fine and enjoyed my stay.

Ken
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connection was NOT reliable or available over entire stay.

review.title: Would not recommend.

When I looked at my pending bill on line from my bank, I was billed for parking twice, been billed for $25 for ????, credited for $25 ????; so I won't know how that plays until I get my final statement. Location by the airport was what we were looking for but not in a 'railroad yard.'

review.title: Nice hotel for a short visit, close to airport.
review.reviewText: Room was clean and quiet. The large beds were comfortable, and the bath was large. There wasn't much room to move around in the room, probably because both beds were king sized. The pillows were filled with chunks of foam. Overall it was a good place to stay for a short visit, very close to the airport with an efficient shuttle to the airport. Breakfast doesn't start until 6, so if you have an early flight you will have to scrounge around at the airport which is a very inefficient place, and leaves you no time for eating.

review.title: Train lovers dream
review.reviewText: Good location to the airport. Mediocre breakfast. Only recommended if you like the sounds of freight trains going by your room at 5AM.

review.title: great stay

review.title: It doesn't get any better
review.reviewText: My wife and I have stayed in many hotels through the U.S.A. We were more than comforted in our stay at the Comfort Inn. The place, clean, healthy, and safe, The service is prompt, courteous, and thorough. The breakfast, its morning offerings and self service convenience helped in making this trip a truly family experience. Our 2+ year old daughter also had a restful time. Thanks so much, you folks at Comfort Inn.
review.positiveRemarks: The roominous, the cleanlines, the tranquility and the great night sleep
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of any thing, just yet.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, quiet area. I personally, enjoyed the occasional sound of the locomotives.

review.title: San Francisco Transportation
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean but it is in front of a railroad that wakes you up in the middle of the night, it makes the room move like if it were an earthquake. The airport shuttle is a plus, but this hotel is NOT near any tourist attraction. You have to take the complimentary airport shuttle to the airport. Then pay to get on the BART that will take you to downtown S.F. then take the bus or F-Line to get to the tourist attractions. Then you have to do the same but in reverse to get back to the hotel. We had to spend about 1.5 hrs each way to get to our destinations a well as pay about $40 roundtrip to get back and forth using the S.F. transportation. A taxi would have been a LOT more money.

review.title: Very nice, good location, at a good price
review.reviewText: It was good. Nice and clean and located close to some nice Chinese restaurants. It was a delight.

review.title: I would give them a second chance
review.reviewText: The hotel is very close to the airport and I got a great rate using one of Expedia's unpublished rate deals. The only things that I found irritating were the following: the hotel seemed to require a great deal of personal information from its guests when checking in and I was charged a fee to park my car at the hotel and there weren't enough parking spaces in the lot to accomdate all of the guests staying that night. Additionally, the Internet service was not working.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel policies and the unreliability of the Internet service
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport

review.title: Functional at best
review.reviewText: Shuttle took longer than expected and driver was very rude. The check-in person I had was not friendly and slightly impatient and short with his answers. The room location was not pleasant. My room was on the 1st floor and not within or secured by the hotel property; therefore, I felt very unsafe walking to my room or being outside at night. It is more a fancy motel than a hotel. The room was clean and spacious. If you arrive at night there is only one restaurant open, Cecilia's; however, their food is very good and I highly recommend the buffalo wings (not actually buffalo flavored, but one of the best-cooked chicken wings I've ever had). The check-out person in the morning was a lot friendlier and more helpful. All-in-all the hotel, or motel, served its purpose for a one-night stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Cecilia's chicken wings, free airport shuttle
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms located outside like motel and not secured by hotel property

review.title: Breakfast Better Than Most
review.reviewText: Great place to stay if you're catching a flight out of San Francisco. We went there in order to tour SF, though, so we didn't care for the sounds of travelers getting ready and leaving in the wee hours of the morning. Also, we had 2 cars and the parking fee for the second vehicle was 35.00/night! Didn't find that out until we arrived. That should have been stated online in the hotel policies. It was clean, modern and well kept, though, and the breakfast was better than most!

review.title: Don't waste your money
review.reviewText:
When I opened the door to our room, all I noticed is the strong mildew smell. When I walked over to open the window, I found the remains of someones shopping spree piled along side the bed as if the maid didn't feel like bending over to pick up the trash and dispose of it.
There was food left in the refrigerator and the shower didn't drain so I guess my feet and ankles got a good soaking. There are no rules when it came to the pool area and the wild banshee children that were in the hot tub almost blasted another woman in the face with a ball several times, not to mention the fact that they were splashing everyone in the area, and I don't mean just a little. I have stayed in much cheaper hotels and not had the same disappointment..

review.title: not recommended

Room was comfortable and the location was very close to the airport. It was a bit noisy - not great sound protection between floors. Overall was good for what we needed. It really was within minutes of the airport.

review.title: Good quality for the price
