Getting downtown to San Francicso was time consuming because you have to take the shutlle back to the airport and take the train in, then cab or cable car from there.

review.title: San Fran vacation
review.reviewText: hotel is closer to SFO airport and therefore cheaper than staying directly in SFO. Hotel is in an industrial area so lots of truck noise and my room was directly across the street from freight train and BART train so somewhat noisy night. We traveled into SFO for sighseeing during the days we were here and only utilized room and hotel for a place to sleep.
review.locationRemarks: All SFO tourist attractions Muir WoodsNapa Valley - rent can and program your GPS and enjoy

review.title: Won't ever return here
review.reviewText: This property does not live up to expectations of the Comfort Suites name. This is an old motel that has been re-branded to Comfort. The rooms are very small, even cramped. The outside elevators smell and are stained with white paint on the floors and walls. The entire property is open to non-guests who can walk through the place unchecked. Our room was supposedly remodeled recently but the peeling wallpaper and an outside door that needed to be repainted (and didn't close unless slammed shut) suggested otherwise. They charge for parking even though it's a motel. This is in an industrial area with commuter and freight trains regularly passing beside the property. The only savings grace is the morning breakfast which was tasty but packed because the property is used by travel/tour bus groups every day. Some of the people in the food area didn't look like guests due to their clothing, appearance and smell. The heated "pool" is the size of a large hot-tub and only has room for 6 people at a time. Excellent freeway access to US 101 within two minutes. All things considered, we will not stay here again and we will recommend our friends avoid this place.

review.title: will go back again sometime.
review.reviewText: Hotel was in process of revamping so it should be very nice when finished.

review.title: Great Trip!
review.reviewText: If you want a clean room and a night's sleep before you fly or travel into the city this is a good stop. A bit noisy if you are by the side the caltrain is on, but you can sleep through it if you are used to traffic noise. Great breakfast and nice people. Parking there was tight and no real food places arounf to speak of. It worked for a cheaper place to stay that was 2 miles from the airport.

review.title: I would stay here again
review.reviewText: staff at the front desk where very professional, the beddings looks expensive, towels where soft, breakfast was good, room was really clean.

review.title: Giants Game
review.reviewText: Good place to stay when going to ATT Park for Giants Game. Took 15 minutes on a Thursday Evening to get to parking lot at BallPark

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Price is fair.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Room smelled funny. The sofa/bed was very dirty and the cushion was torn really bad.

review.title: very diry
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel because we saw the picture of the pool, althought it did said workout room and jacazzu but when we saw the picture of the pool, we decided to booked it, well it was not there. Hotel is very dirty, the room smell and sticky everything you touch, very loud all night, we got the 1st floor and you can hear the roller board from 2nd and 3rd floor, could not sleep all night. The front desk staff don't want to be bother, We asked the male front desk staff to change the room and he was very grumpy and rude. Will not stay here again.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Older hotel in need of updating. Three of us stayed in one King Room with pull out sofa and housekeeping had a hard time understanding that we needed 3 sets of towels, one for each member of our party. We had to make this request 4 consecutive days. No variety to the breakfast, same for all of the days we stayed.

review.title: Nice hotel. Convenient location
review.reviewText: I totally recommend this hotel. It's clean, nice attention, convenient location.

review.title: just a stay
review.reviewText: carless

review.title: Comfort Suite
review.reviewText: Never been a fan of exterior hallways. TV's very old. Older hotel, but room was clean.

review.title: Great Hotel with LOUD location
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel for three nights and every night was the same. The first thing I noticed was the passenged train light rail thing that passed by what seemed to be every 20-30 mins during the day and probably every hour at night...HOLY MOLY this thing was so loud. If you stay at this hotel make sure you request the side that is farthest away from the tracks. ALSO our room was right next to the stupid fitness room. Let me just say that whenever someone was in there on the treadmill.. then weights..then the bike..then whatever else they did WE COULD HEAR IT. Especially that stupid treadmill. My recommendation is DO NOT PUT A FITNESS ROOM ON THE SECOND FLOOR AND BE SURE THAT NO ROOMS ARE RIGHT NEXT TO IT.
OH the area was really nice..there was a gas station right down the road with a wendys and a star bucks...and the hotel's breakfast was great! boiled eggs waffles sausage toast muffins..fruit...etc

review.title: they truly do what they can
review.reviewText: I had been driving all night, and had to get up very early next day...They were very nice and understanding, and got me checked in as early as they possibly could so that I could get some sleep.. I use this hotel at least twice a year and will continue using them...they are awsome.......

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText:
First day of check in was a little strange - several times in the evening someone knocked on the door but when we went to the door, no one was there and then someone actually opened our door but the security latch stopped them from entering. After I called the front desk, everything stopped.

Hotel is next to an interstate and a railroad track so there was alot of evening noise (our room was in the front) and it is located in an industrial area - had to go to another hotel to eat dinner in their restaurant, not much close by.

review.title: NOt bad
review.reviewText: It was nice place how ever make sure you request a room not next to the train station.

review.title: Close to airport but Dirty!
review.reviewText: Bugs in the bathroom. I was worried there was bed bugs. I do not recommend this hotel!

review.title: Worked well for us.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at Comfort Inn & Suites. It was comfortable, convenient, and worked well for our trip.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: Ok for one night, but too small for an extended stay. The only problem was the microwave was in the bathroom, so while my teenagers showered, it made it difficult to warm dinner for the rest of us. A table in the room would of been nice as well.

review.title: good stay
review.reviewText: good stay, comfortable room, nice breakfast, very close to airport-great location

review.title: great quality, for resonable price
review.reviewText: enjoyed stay; really enjoyed the continental breakfast. the room was comfortable and staff was friendly. we picked this hotel due to the amount of amenities provided that other nearby hotels didn't have. They have free parking, breakfast, wi-fi and a hot tub. It was able to please all members of the family.

review.title: great value for night stay before trip out of SF
review.reviewText: We went to the 49ers game on sunday and had an early flight out of SF so the location was selected for the trip home. The hotel was perfect, great location, good food the morning we left and great hospitality.

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText: I stay at this motel occasionally when traveling via SFO. It is close to the airport and good value for money. On this occasion, however, parts of the property were being renovated. Consequently, the noise interfered with our rest.

review.title: S. San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText:
The location is good, but noisy since it's near the airport and the train.
Otherwise, everything was to be expected for a two-star hotel. The bathroom could have been cleaner, but the staff was friendly.
I forgot my toothbrush, and staff brought one to my room.
Breakfast was good as well. All in all, a good hotel for the price.

review.title: Fair Price...that's about it
review.reviewText: Convenient location. It wouldn't take much effort to clean this hotel up. The rooms are older and the walls were dirty. Not impressed....

review.title: Very convenient off highway and very comfortable
review.reviewText: We found this hotel to be very accommodating, clean and met our needs. The staff were very professional and helpful.

review.title: Not really impressed
review.reviewText:
The room appeared clean, but since I am all-that about cleanliness, i checked the bed for bed bugs. There were none, but i did find that there were some stains on the comforter sheet of the bed. That made me not want to touch the sheets. I know they change out the white sheets but how often do they change the comforters?

The water was so alkaline it was bitter. It was only noticeable when we brushed our teeth and rinsed.

The internet was frustrating!! Although it was free wiifi, it was worse than the free dial-up internet in the olden days. It was so slow and most of the time disconnected us. We waited 5 mins to connect for 30seconds of page loading just to be disconnected again. After we changing locations to get better reception and after the front desk people restarted the internet twice, we still couldn't connect to search up places we wanted to visit in SF. How inconvenient and a waste of time.

review.title: Good value for money Hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here 3 or 4 times in last 5 years, friendly staff, clean decent sized rooms. Quiet. Easy access to San Francisco City center (15min drive on 101) Decent breakfast included. Free wireless internet & free use of PC/printer in foyer. Free airport shuttle. Bart transport at airport. A few restaurants close by. Shopping mall close approx 1 mile.

review.title: nice and comfort
review.reviewText: the sofa bed is not comfortable. breakfast is ok.

review.title: So-So @ The Comfort Inn
review.reviewText: Overall, not bad for the price. I know sofa beds aren't usually very comfortable, but this one was unbearable. Moved the mattress to the floor. And the hot tub (which is why I chose this over other hotels) was not working.

review.title: Great Price and so close to Downtown
review.reviewText: If you plan on visiting everyplace in and around SF this is the best bet for the money. Plus you have a great hot breakfast buffet every morning. Easy access from the freeway.

review.title: The Comfort Inn was anything but comfortable
review.reviewText: When we arrived, our room was dirty. The carpet was stained, was missing fixtures (the capped wires were hanging out), smelled of smoke, missing linens, etc. Disgusted by the sights and smells, we went to the front desk to try and get a different room. The man working behind the counter was rude and insisted that they were fully booked. Considering that we saw several rooms that looked completely empty, we inquiry about those rooms. If they had not arrived yet, why couldn't they get our room and we get theirs? Long story short, it took us an hour to get one of his staff to take a look at our room to confirm it was indeed dirty and smelled. We were transferred to another room, which was cleaner but had a strong smoke smell. We ended getting coffee from downstairs and leaving around open cups to combat the smell. The area is questionable and located literally across the street from the train. I can't help but wonder why all the other hotels/motels in the area looked cleaner and nicer than ours. Next time I'd rather pay the extra $20-30/night extra for something more decent.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Hotel was a very good value. The room was clean, staff was freindly, and the price was reasonable. However, the GPS had a difficult time finding the location.

review.title: Excellent service
review.reviewText: Location is a bit hidden by trees,but otherwise highly recommended

review.title: Okay for the price
review.reviewText: Nothing fancy, but still a nice room for the price. We got a king suite (king sized bed with queen sized sofa bed). If you're planning a longer stay, the suite comes with a mini fridge, cabinet to store food, and a microwave. Despite being by the highway, the hotel area is pretty quiet.

review.title: will come back again
review.reviewText: nice hotel, and nice complimentary breakfast. will come back again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: I would recommend this service to friends and family

review.title: Pleasent hotel but nowhere to eat and miles from town
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. Breakfast was good and there was plenty of it. The main problem is that it is about 10 miles from the city and a taxi is $40 each way. There is a nearby hotel where you can eat but the menu is very limited. We did not feel safe being out after dark in this out of town location, and most of the taxi drivers didn't know where it was. This was the only Comfort Suite we used. We switched to Best Western for the rest of the 3 week road trip and found them superb. I would not recommend this as a family hotel.

review.title: Not at all impressed
review.reviewText: Comfort Inn San Francisco Aiprort. Stay away guys....the place is falling apart. Sunny

review.title: Excellent value for money
review.reviewText: Hotel well situated easy access to transport & airport, will need a car though. Friendly staff, clean rooms free internet access, free continental breakfast. Room refurbishment ongoing at present, but no disturbance to guests.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: First visit to this hotel: This is an older restored hotel in which the original design might have served it's day well. And for quickstop-overs its convenient. But room interiors are deficient in design and comfort. Furnishings and carpeting are 'cheap', about the level of an older Motel 6... therefore a disapointment. The building is very close to a freeway overpass. Part of hotel parking is under the overpass. The one area of satisfaction I saw was in the front office staff who were very friendly and professional. Complimentary continental breakfast was about Holiday Inn Express level. It would not be my choice to return.

review.title: You got what you pay for
review.reviewText: Decent hotel but certainly not a suite.

review.title: Depending on the location of the room
review.reviewText: My room was located just under the freeway, and the sound outside easily came in. However, the room was very clean and large, and also there seemed to be many rooms far from such big roads. Very near to the airport and economical.

review.title: The property needs new room fixtures and room renovations
review.reviewText: Staff is very freindly and helpful. The problem is the rooms, carpets, beds and bathroom fixtures. All are old, musty and mildew odor in the room is bad., the beds are old and have no firmness or integrity, the bathrooms are worn, bathroom door doesnt close. The deoderizer being used to nuetralize the mildew smell is very strong. It is unfortunate the rooms do not match up to the staffs freindliness, the continental breakfast is nicely done, and the access to high spped in the lobby is very helpful.

review.title: clean, dependable, and comfortable
review.reviewText: clean and comfortable

review.title: Comfortable at reasonable rate
review.reviewText: In general, I enjoyed my 3 nights at Comfort Suites. The room was clean, the noise level was low although the hotel is located right next to the highway, and it's easy to get to the highway 101. I also like the fact that they have a microwave oven in the room. Parking space could be a little packed. (I was there during new year holiday, what can I say) One thing I don't like is the heavy, sliding, bathroom door. Not a big deal, however. It will be one of my choices of the place to stay next time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Customer service was top notch
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very helpful when asked if we could have a late checkout. They were able to accomadate us with no problems. After working all night we really appreciated their willingness to help.

review.title: Holiday Week
review.reviewText: Probably because of the Thanksgiving weekend I had piece and quiet on the 3rd floor..One drawback is the commuter train (Amtrak) but freeway is close by as well as airport with schedule shuttle service...I would definitley go back...

review.title: So So ...
review.reviewText: Hotel location was not easy to find. In addition, front peaple din't give us understandable direction. I think they also didn't know where they are located!

review.title: Cozy hotel. Access a bit tricky
review.reviewText: Well maintained and good services with friendly staff. The access to the hotel is a bit tricky though.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, nothing fancy but clean and comfortable. May be a little noisy in the morning on weekdays if your room faces highway. Good breakfast. Close to SF airport with free shuttle. If you don't want to rent a car it's a perfect solution - Caltrain station is 5 minutes walk from the hotel, takes you to downtown SF - 10 minutes walk to Moscono Center, Market and 15 minutes to Union Square.

review.title: clean, friendly, and convenient
review.reviewText: friendly and accommodating staff with clean rooms

review.title: Good For a Basic, No Frills Place to Rest Your Head
review.reviewText: This hotel is an adequate place to stay. The property has buildings in a diamond pattern, with greenbelt and hot tub in a center courtyard. There is a train train next to the site so be sure to get a room away from the tracks. Wireless internet is available. My computer connected to the network and got the logon screen but wouldn't go beyond it. A call to the 800 number was needed and five minutes later everything was working as it should. Breakfast is decent. The hot items are waffles, hard-boiled eggs, and sausage. Waffles take 2 minutes to cook so get there early if you don't want to wait in line.

review.title: Nothing spectacular
review.reviewText: This hotel wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. I would recommend it, though it is average. It's not too far from downtown San Francisco, just 15 minutes. The hotel grounds were well kept, as were the rooms. Staff was friendly, but not too detail oriented, and offered no recommendations as to what to do or where to eat during our stay. The parking was actually quite bad, as the spots were very narrow and limited in number. We'd go there again only if there was no other choice.

review.title: I shall recommend to my friends
review.reviewText: I shall recommend to my friends

review.title: Pleased
review.reviewText: We were pleased with the hotel stay. The room was nice. They are painting the outside so it looks new.

review.title: friendly and clean
review.reviewText: always a friendly greeting upon arrival and checkout

review.title: A disappointment
review.reviewText: Staff poorly trained in basic customer service. while exterior was being painted during our stay, overall the hotel was looking worn. Breakfast did not open at 6am as advertised. No system for reservations on airport shuttle (bus was within 2 seats of being full at 4:30am departure.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel, well maintained, and conveniently located. The breakfast is good too. I would go back anytime.

review.title: convenient and comfortable
review.reviewText: staff is friendly and clean rooms well maintained

review.title: festering with smoke and curry
review.reviewText: Do not stay here if you are sensitive to the smell of smoke, strong odor of curry, and would rather not sleep on a lop-sided bed. We rented two rooms close to one another and eventually had to settle for far-apart. Our first two rooms smelled of curry and smoke although the hotel itself says they are all non-smoking suites. One of our re-assigned rooms smelled of smoke again and the bed was very lop-sided. We had to settle for one of these rooms due to a sold out situation. I think I will stick with the two other non smoking chains we usually frequent.

review.title: would not recommend
review.reviewText: Hotel needs to be renovated. My allergies got so bad with all the dust and old smell. And the area was very seedy. I felt safe in the hotel but not safe at all even crossing the street.

review.title: Good waffles
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay there. It was close to the freeway and to downtown South San Francisco. The staff was friendly and their continental breakfast was far beyond what I was expecting. Great waffles and friendly staff preparing them and a nice cozy atmosphere to have a little something before exploring the city. Definitely ask for a room facing the jacuzzi for a quieter nite, since it is located in the industrial part of the city.

review.title: always friendly and clean rooms
review.reviewText: convenient, clean, and helpful friendly staff

review.title: nice place for the price
review.reviewText: Yummy waffles at breakfast Very quiet hotel

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent a weekend in November'06 in this hotel, mainly because we made our plans pretty much at the last minute and this was the best deal we were getting at the time. The hotel is located just minutes from the airport and very close to South San Francisco downtown and the 101 freeway. It's about 15 minutes drive to San Francisco downtown. Since we rented a car, the distance from the main San Francisco attractions was not much of an issue with us. We'd leave in the morning and come back late at night, so didn't spend much of our time at the hotel. The room itself was clean and in good shape, the room service was prompt and good too. Beware though that the bathroom didn't have a door! - which took us quite by surprise. The morning complimentary breakfast was reasonable - the usual continental fare. There are a number of restaurants in the area (about 10-15 mins walking distance), and they also deliver to the hotel. There are a couple of vending machines if you need a late night snack or drink. We encountered no major issues and overall had a comfortable stay here.

review.title: Comfort Inn
review.reviewText: Old hotel in an industrial area with no restaurants in area.

review.title: yuck
review.reviewText: Found fleas in my bed, poorly functioning tub. Overall, kind of a dump. Only good things were the free breakfast and location.

review.title: clean, comfortable, good value
review.reviewText: We had not stayed in Comfort Inns before, we picked this particular hotel because the price was very reasonable and it was close to the airport for an early morning flight. We thought our room was very clean and modern. Roomy enough for two large suitcases and we were not tripping over them. The continental breakfast was average, but nice in offering hot waffles made yourself which beats just donuts and juice. We would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

review.title: very near the airport
review.reviewText: the hotel have shuttle service from the airport

review.title: Comfort Inn
review.reviewText: It is very far from the city - travel expenses were unexpected, but the hotel itself was nice. The employees were more than helpful in accommodating our business and comfort needs.

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: When I arrived in my room everything was clean except the toliet bowl. I called front desk and they took care of it right away. Friendly service and comp. breakfast and internet. There was protesters everyday outside of the hotel, and we were placed in the room furthest away from them. Overall I am satisfy w/ the room, but they lack recreational facilities.

review.title: Great Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: It's actually cheaper to stay in South San Francisco than in San Francisco itself. We rented a car and then commuted from the hotel which was only about 20 minutes away It also had free parking (a rarity in the city). But you can also use the public tranportation Bart system. The room was clean, King bed spacious, and complimentary breakfast GREAT. I'd go back.

review.title: Best Value for the $$
review.reviewText: Considering the very expensive and not so nice hotels in the city, this hotel is ideal considering it is only 10 minutes from downtown. if you have a car, it is ideal, as it connects to the 101 easily. The staff are very polite, the rooms are clean and the grounds are very pleasent. The breakfast is very good, considering it is complementary. For what you are paying you get a lot, and most important the parking is free!! All hotels in the city charge to park on top of the hotel rates. You feel safe and secure at the hotel. This is our third stay at this hotel, and will come back again and again!!

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: Hotel is very clean and nicely kept, pretty good continental breakfast. The only drawback being it's close proximity to the rail lines, this can lead to some very loud noises all night long, and I mean, all night long. Other than that, it is conveniantly located off HWY 101, short distance from the airport. Overall a pretty good experience, just stay in the rooms opposite (furthest) the rail lines.

review.title: Very nice stay!
review.reviewText: Well kept motel and grounds. Continental breakfast ewxceptional.

review.title: Excellent SFO airport hotel
review.reviewText: Good value here. Rooms are large, comfortable and clean. Easy walk into an interesting area of South San Francisco for an ethnic dinner.

review.title: Convenient to city and airport
review.reviewText: A great base of operations for our Bay Area vacation, South San Francisco was conveniently located by the airport for departure to our early morning flight. Parking was free, and the complimentary breakfast, although crowded, was well stocked. Just make sure you get a room on the side away from the train!

review.title: Never Again
review.reviewText: Internet server kept disconnecting,television stations all had poor reception, bed was old and uncomfotable, toilet clogged, noisy service early in the morning, room went unserviced 2 days out of the 5 I stayed there. Nope,I will not stay here again.

review.title: Get a room away from the train!
review.reviewText: My room was about 30 yards from a train that ran around the clock. I slept through it at night, but my boyfriend (whose a light sleeper) did not get a very restful trip. Breakfast was great every morning with items including waffles, fresh fruit, muffins, bagels and juice. Which was a great way to start the day. The room had a fridge and a microwave which was helpful for storing cold drinks and leftover food (we were on a budget).

review.title: Very enjoyable
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, quiet, friendly staff, we really enjoyed the deluxe breakfast in the morning.

review.title: Comfort Suites San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Computer available for guest use. Close to the airport.

review.title: Average and affordable
review.reviewText: We would stay at Comfort Suites again, our room was small but nice. We appreciated having a refrigerator and microwave, and the breakfast was fabulous. Our room was on the backside which was as far from the lobby as one could get. Therefore we did not get internet access in our room. We specifically chose this hotel because they had free wireless internet, so this was disappointing. Don't count on having internet in your room. The hotel service was average, as was the cleanliness of the room. The bed was too soft. We returned to our room one day and housekeeping hadn't latched our door shut, so our room had been open all day. Fortunately, all our belongings were intact. The location of the hotel was in a very safe neighborhood with little activity and was very quiet. One exception - on two mornings, union protesters woke us up at 7 a.m. The shuttle service to the airport was continuous and regular, we utilized this daily to take the BART train in to the city. That was very convenient. We have high praise for the city's public transportation system, it was very easy to navigate for first-time travelers to San Francisco. There is a Wendys, Starbucks, and gas station within walking distance to the hotel. For the affordable price, it was definitely worth it for the budget or business traveler.

review.title: comfort for your money
review.reviewText: this hotel is worth the price

review.title: Great choice
review.reviewText: Great breakfast. They had coin laundry which was helpful for us. Parking was difficult as the parking lot was packed full. Staff was very helpful. Rooms were clean and quiet. Shuttle was to BART operated as stated. Picketers were present as mentioned, and heckled us to "Check out now---Don't check in," and "Get your green card." Apparently they didn't do their job well enough and were replaced with better workers? Not sure, but that too is now just a memory that we think made that hotel different and interesting. I would definitely stay there again and recommend to others.

review.title: A Good Base To Tour San Francisco From
review.reviewText: This hotel was excellent value for travellers on a budget. Free airport transfers, friendly staff, clean and nicely decorated rooms and a nice selection and plentiful supply of both hot and cold food for breakfast included in the price. Dont let its location in a mainly industrial area, close to the freeway (there is some noise) put you off. With free parking and downtown San Francisco only a 20 minute drive away, this is a good base to tour San Francisco from and at a fraction of the cost of the downtown hotels.

review.title: Comfort Suites, San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, comfortable, good breakfast and had easy access to the freeway. Protestors only bothered once, but not to the point of making us leave or changing our minds about staying there again. We will definitely stay there again in the future. It was also very affordable! Thank you!

review.title: Great value for the price
review.reviewText: Convenient location. The microwave and fridge were an added bonus. Can catch the shuttle to the airport to take the BART into town, or if driving, it is right off the 101 into town. Perfect for those who need a place to sleep at night and tour SanFrancisco and on down the coast during the day!

review.title: Good Hotel Value
review.reviewText: My husband, son, and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. We stayed here last year as well, and feel the hotel is a good value for the money. The room was clean, the service was good, the towels and pillows were extremely high quality, and the breakfast was enjoyable and plentiful. If you are looking for a good value in the San Francisco area, this is the place.

review.title: business or pleasure
review.reviewText: If the hotel wants to cater to business travelers, they need to close the hot tub earlier than 11:00 p.m.

review.title: Good for a home base at a price
review.reviewText: Hotel is near freeways, Bart, airport. Rooms are quiet nevertheless. I have stayed here a couple of times as I spend almost no time at the hotel. It is clean and safe. Parking is tight but free. The staff is helpful despite what other reviews say. The microwave, fridge, coffee maker are appreciated. The pull out couch was not needed but was a disaster if you really needed it. Check you room first. The continental breakfast is good and well stocked. Bottom line: good for the price.

review.title: a nice stay
review.reviewText: we were very satisfied with our stay at comfort suites. the south san francisco bart station was pretty close to the hotel - access into the city using public transportation (no parking worries) was a major concern. free parking was a requirement. other than that, we just wanted somewhere to stay that was decent, clean, and where we felt safe. we weren't planning to spend much time in the hotel (otherwise, what's the point of traveling?), and therefore, didn't want to spend much on the room. we weren't even expecting a microwave and refrigerator. it was perfect for what we were looking for.

review.title: I won't be staying there again
review.reviewText: Location is convenient to SFO, SF and US 101 and price is OK. Basic maintenance on room was lacking. Although a clean room, the air conditioning/heater air filter was not maintained and contaminated the room at night with mold or other particulate material that was a respiratory irritant. I didn't run the unit after the first night. Room had coffee maker, but glass pot in maker didn't match the filter holder, so coffee wouldn't drain into the pot. You had to manually trip the holder drain with your finger to get coffee out into a cup. When I filed a maintenance request at the desk, the desk manager seemed well aware of the problems, but left the impression that these were long-standing or recurring problems that were common in the complex and only being slowly addressed if at all. My next trip to SF won't include a stay at this motel.

review.title: OK, for price!!
review.reviewText: The Hotel is showing some age, esp. carpet and unpainted ceiling damage. Refrig. and TV remote didn't work both were replaced in timely manner w/ no complaints. Near freeway, but room was pretty quiet. Breakfast was ok, large but nothing special. Overall for the price - it was fair.

review.title: Order food or find a local eatery on the west side of 101
review.reviewText: Hotel is in good shape. Close to airport & free shuttle. We got in late and left at 4:30 am, so we just needed a place to shower and sleep. Print a map if you are not familiar with the area.

review.title: It is a nice hotel
review.reviewText: it is a nice hotel, but the servant is not so nice. We order for three people, but the hotel only provide us one blanket, we ask for one more, they did not provide!

review.title: Excellent lodging!!`
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 4 nights over the Thanksgiving holiday and were very pleased. The staff was excellent and very helpful; the room was nice and clean; housekeeping did a great job; parking was no problem at any time; the courtyard area was very clean and well maintained; the continental breakfast was very good and well stocked at all times. We would definately stay at this hotel again. Very close to airport and easy on and off the freeway!!

review.title: Great continential breakfast!!
review.reviewText: Great customer service. Best continential breakfast ive ever had for the price i paid for the stay. I would definitely go back.

review.title: Good low cost hotel.
review.reviewText: I was disappointed that we didn't have 2 Queens beds - the sofa bed was horrrible.

review.title: Decent deal
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel for a week Bad points - The couch bed was broken, the outside grounds were somewhat messy. Good points - The location was great, very convenient to freeway, the maid service was very good. The hot tub was very large and clean and in a nice setting outside. No cocktail lounge, the breakfast bar was decent, but get there early. For the price a pretty good deal.

review.title: Good but....
review.reviewText: San Francisco is veynice city but dirty, so we can't expect more from the hotels. It's not that bad. But if you wanna stay in good hotel, you have to pay a lot. So you got what you pay ;-)) Next time I wish I can stay in Sausalito or other nice towns around the city. They are very nice ;-)))

review.title: It's Ok because...
review.reviewText: This hotel was OK for my husband and me because we spent most of our time enjoying SF!! we were out early in the morning adn we would return later at night so I have no complains. Our room was clean,the bed was comfy, they have a really fast check in and check out so, what more could we ask for?

review.title: good location, good price.
review.reviewText: I have stayed here several times and enjoy being freeway close next the airport and just a 10 minute ride into downtown San Francisco. Rooms and bed are nice size with a sleeper sofa, only drawback is no pool just a hot tub.

review.title: Great price and only ten minutes from downtown
review.reviewText: I'd stay there again

review.title: would not use this hotel again
review.reviewText: bathroom floor had a thick layer of dust under the sink. Air conditioner was very noisey and cycled on and off too often. Bed not very comfortable.

review.title: Comfortable and easy to find
review.reviewText: The hotel is easy to find near the 101 freeway. The shuttle to the airport is nice and comfortable. The driver was courteous and helpful with our luggage. I appreciate the free parking for a week. I will stay here again when I fly out of SFO. Thanks.

review.title: When in town would stay there again
review.reviewText: It was a relief to be able to retire to a clean and comfortable room after a long business day.

review.title: Ok for a quick stay close to the airport
review.reviewText: It was ok for a quick stay if I need to be close to the airport. It shows signs of a little needed TLC in the upkeep/appearance in the rooms. The carpet and smell in the elevator was less than appealing.

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: Good choise before or after flight

review.title: Good value for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good breakfast. Room and surroundings were in need of a renovation. All the amenities were in working order, but the wireless internet access was slow. It is a 2 min drive to the South SF town centre where there are a few restaurants, laundry, etc. There was also a bit of noise from planes flying overhead.

review.title: inexpensive/close to airport
review.reviewText: A relatively inexpensive option close to the airport for a short term stay. The room was nothing special. The continental breakfast provided morning nourishment. Shuttle provided transportation to/from airport/metro. Basically, no frills but not too costly either!

review.title: Cheap, Clean and Free Breakfast
review.reviewText: The hotel is right next to the freeway so its 10 mins to downtown, and very quiet during the day or night. The room is spacious with a refrigerator and microwave and its all in the package deal. Breakfast is served every day, and free internet in the lobby with a printer!

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText: Clean, efficient, well maintained breakfast in the am was nice

review.title: Inexpensive, but don't expect too much.
review.reviewText: You can't beat the price, but don't expect too much. It is an older hotel with some work that needs to be done. On the positive side, the parking is free and so is the breakfast. The negative is that the toilet ran constantly and the mattress was well worn. When in the San Fran area, most people don't spend a lot of time in room, so I would recommend this hotel for an inexpensive stay.

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: Reasonable price and convenient location. Shuttle service is good. Will come back again.

review.title: Worth the money
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, not impressed nor dissatisfied. Hotel shuttle was convienent. No problems with parking, hotel offered free internet access and a guest laundry. Breakfast was good. Fast food restaurants and a gas station within a half mile.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel with friendly staff. Close to the airport with free shuttle bus. Free parking and free breakfast of muffins, juice, toast, coffee, etc. Very close to 101 providing easy access to San Francisco and San Jose. 10-15 minutes drive to downtown. Room includes king size bed with double bed sofa.

review.title: An above average stay at a below average price
review.reviewText: The suite was spacious. The bed was comfortable. The tv worked well. The wireless internet functioned flawlessly once I got it going, and the telephone support was great. The free continental breakfast sucked. If you got there early, as I did the first day, there was enough, but if you got there later, as I did on the second day, there weren't enough chairs to sit down on, and they kept running out of things. The wait was so long to get what little food was left, I gave up and ate elsewhere. Other similar hotels offer waffles and eggs, but this was just rolls, cold cereal, packaged oatmeal, juice and coffee. Pretty marginal fare.

review.title: Convenient to SFO
review.reviewText: Very convenient to SFO just off Highway 101 but noisy because of 101 and the railroad and South San Francisco station right next to the hotel.

review.title: not very impressed
review.reviewText: slightly run down, but fairly comfortable.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a "fancy hotel", this isn't it, but if you are looking for a good deal on a nice, clean hotel you've found it here! It is clean, the staff was SO HELPFUL & it was conveniently located. The continental Breakfast was nice & we also used the hot tub, which was clean and nice & hot!!

review.title: It was okay...would stay again, but would look elsewhere first...
review.reviewText: I stayed 3 nights over a weekend. I like things to look neat, clean, and new. The outside, and lobby looked neat, clean, and new. The rooms, stairwells, etc....looked neat, relatively clean, but not new. Here goes some little critiques: One of two bulbs in bathroom fixture went out occasionally, I called front desk on first day. It was never fixed all weekend. The bathroom (and room) had a strong mildew smell. I called the frontdesk on the first evening, and like the bulbs was told it would be taken care of. It was not. I complained again about the mildew, and was assured that it would be taken care of, but I never gave them chance. I went and bought some bleach and cleaned the bathroom curtain and floor myself. (It solved the problem.) Like I said, the room was neat, and clean, but not completely "new looking" (ex. small chipped paint here and there, and couch not so clean..) Also, parking was very tight...but it was not a big problem. Note, they never offered to change my room. If I had not solved the smell problem (a big deal for me), I would have been very dissatisfied.

review.title: Don't plan on breakfast!
review.reviewText: One of the "extras" that Comfort Sites touts in their advertising is the free breakfast. You will only get breakfast if you show up at 6:30 am, or are very persistant. The breakfast area is very small and there is very limited seating. We ended up standing trying to eat Cheerios. The hotel is fine, but don't use the free breakfast as a signifigant element in your decision making.

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: Overall satisfaction with this hotel was normal and it was good hotel for lodges during a couple of nights. However,the public-telephone's condition was unsatisfacted.

review.title: Good place to stay for a great price.
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and nice but a bit dated. However, you can't beat the price for a King + a Queen/sofa bed.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: This is a great place to stay. Each time we go this is the place we choose! We love the frig and microwave in the room.

review.title: Plenty of room
review.reviewText: Convenient to S.F. Large suite and bath with all amenities. Only problem I've encountered is with parking as this is a very popular hotel a/c price,location and room condition.

review.title: Clean, close to most attractions, good breakfast and excellent overall value!!
review.reviewText:
I was really impressed with the quality of service, cleanliness of the room and breakfast service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to San Francisco.

The only minor issue we came across was lack of parking. The hotel has barely enough parking when it is fully booked. They allowed us to park in the fire lane for one evening.

review.title: Nice Getaway
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with free breakfast.  Free shuttle to and from SFO airport.  Hotel isn't close to any food stores or restaurants, However you can walk 10-15 min up a hill to chinese or mexican.

review.title: Affordable but not impressed
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable. Good to stay in for a place to sleep for a night. Lots of noise from nearby aree (BART train and other trains). No restarant in hotel, and none within waking distance.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Very conveniently located near the airport. Clean rooms

review.title: Park and Fly
review.reviewText: The hotel has easy freeway access and the shuttle service was easy to use.

review.title: Wonderful location, very quiet, and the rooms are just what you need in a hotel.
review.reviewText: Very Nice people and generous employees!

review.title: Comfort Suites San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Convenient and easy to SFI Airport.

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: They do not have enough parking spaces for the numbers of rooms.
